intro: Heleniastrum occidentale, commonly known as the western heleniastrum, is a flowering plant native to the western regions of North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disc. Heleniastrum occidentale is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
